enWisdom: Ignorance makes one stumble and brings regret

Wisdom: الْجَهْلُ مَطِيَّةٌ شَمُوسٌ مَنْ رَكِبَهَا زَلَّ وَمَنْ صَحِبَهَا ضَلَّ [ظل‏]
enWisdom: Ignorance is a balky mount; whoever rides it stumbles and whoever accompanies it is led astray
Making many mistakes points towards excessive ignorance
One who does not know where he is placing his foot, trips
One who is ignorant makes many blunders
Lapses are a cause of regret
The lapse of an intelligent person is a crushing blow

Wisdom: زَلَّةُ الَمْتُوَقِّي أَشَدُّ زَلَّةٍ وَعِلَّةُ اللَّوْمِ أَقْبَحُ عِلَّةٍ
enWisdom: The lapse of one who is [evidently] pious is the worst of lapses and the sickness of ignobility is the most repulsive of sicknesses
The slip of the foot is the easiest to recover from [unlike other lapses]
